# PR Summary

- Exclude extra IsHomePath() calls
- Make AddQualifier() and RemoveQualifier() static
- Make close code being span-based to reduce allocations

## PR Context

First motivation was to exclude extra IsHomePath() calls. 
LocationGlobber code is based on string operations and so it is a source of a huge amount of memory allocations. Then some low level methods was optimized with using ReadOnlySpan-s to reduce allocations and increase performance. This will later help to further optimize the performance of this code.

@TravisEz13 After bit investigations I see that we switched from OpenCover to CodeCov and our CIs generate code coverage artifacts for all platforms but these report is not uploaded to CodeCov site.
CodeCov docs say that the site supports [report merging](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/merging-reports). Also it is possible set a[ custom flag](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/flags) at uploading report time. (Although there is a note that this is disabled in the Compare page temporarily). The feature allows upload many reports from different CIs for the same commit/PR. It seems that is what was required for cross-platform code coverage reports? Can MSFT team resume this uploading?
